main event: On August 4, 1955, two persons in Alexandria, Louisiana reported seeing an oval-shaped, glowing reddish-orange object traveling at high speed and low altitude, which disappeared without leaving a trail. The conclusion was that it was likely a meteor.
interesting points: The sighting occurred around 1352 hours and was visually confirmed by witnesses only, with no radar targets detected; a witness described a later sighting of a metallic object hovering and changing shape; another witness reported strong tingling sensation during an observation; one object was estimated to be moving at 5000 miles per hour and was observed for about 10 minutes; several officers in the area corroborated the bright, round object sighting at a high altitude.
witness description: Two persons reported the sighting, including descriptions of high speed and low altitude objects with peculiar characteristics.
